intro: Phyllanthus phillyreifolius var. triangularis, commonly known as the triangular leaf phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular-shaped leaves, which give it its common name. The plant is native to parts of Africa and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. The plant is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique foliage.
